content.description:
This pitch is on the upper headwall as an alternative to pitch three of 'Agent of entropy'. This pitch tackles the thin and sometimes flaring crack to the left of Agent. For the full experience stay off the bolt line and head directly up from the belay and mounting the pinacle from the left. The real climbing begins here up the steep wall with jams and laybacks.



Climb the first two pitches of Agent of entropy and then head directly up from the second belay rather than taking the bolt line to the right. 

Rack up to 0.75 camalot. Offsets are helpful but not necessary. Rap ring anchor

This route begins on Tycho ledge to the right of The Sentinel. Tackles the slabby face that takes you up to the orange headwall for pitch 3. Pitch one 10c, 28m 10 bolts with a crux getting over to the anchor/belay ledge. Pitch two 10d, 34m 11 bolts. This pitch has a crux at the second bolt with a few more cruxy sections between excellent stances/ledges. Pitch 3 11d, 20m takes on the steep orange headwall. Use a 70m rope to rappel pitch two.



The route starts with the lowest two bolts left of the tree on the right of Tycho ledge.

Bolts with rap ring anchors.

A consistent crack that tapers from fingers to fists as you climb higher. The route has several crux sections but also has good restful stances. The position can't be beat.



Get here by either climbing the firs two pitches of 'agent of entropy' or use the bolted traverse from the routes to the right. This line is the right hand slightly overhanging crack with its own belay anchor.

Full rack to 4" with doubles of 4 and 3 and possibly triples of #1. Some may want to place a #5 right off the belay but it isn't necessary. Some sharp rocks at the top so watch the rope line on rappel.

A bolted traverse linking the belay of Con artist with the routes in development on the next buttress. Nice exposure and moves traversing in both directions. The bolt closest to the Con artist belay is quite high to protect a follower so be sure to clip it.



Traverses from the belay ledge for upper headwall pitches to the routes under development on the buttress to climbers right.

4 bolts.

Three tricky pitches of incredibly varied climbing. Super fast to dry. All anchors have rap rings.

-Pitch1- 30m. Climb past 4 bolts in a shallow corner to reach good cracks to the top. Anchor is found on a detached pillar on your left. An alternate pitch continues right up the wide crack to another anchor. Don't stop at the lower-off anchor halfway up the pitch.

-Pitch 2- 35m. Step left from the belay ledge into a corner with a small roof 5 meters above. Above the roof follow wide cracks to a gigantic belay ledge. The green traverse heads left from here to access Con Artist and other climbs. 

-Pitch 3- 25m. Walk towards a visible anchor but begin climbing right before it. Easy climbing up blocks and flakes to a difficult crux and the top.

Rap the main Climb with a 70m or use all extra anchors with a 60m.



Furthest Right route on tycho ledge. Follow bolts up a shallow corner. 

Single rack to four. Doubles .5-3. A number five is nice on the second pitch.

Named after the short story that inspired '2001 a space odyssey'. Climb the slightly overhanging monolithic feature. Off balance climbing to the midway rest and then the hard climbing starts up the blank looking face and thin seam.



Single pitch bolt line at the left of Tycho ledge.

10 bolts, sport anchor.

This ledge is the starting point for several current and future lines. The ledge got severely bombed during development so it's namesake is the lunar crater from the the Kubrick film '2001 a space odyssey'  where the monolith was discovered.
